name: Matthew Borg Game Prototypes
description:
This semester we were tasked with making four games, following four themes:

1. Changing Seasons

This game was a simple starting dip into game design using Processing 3. You get yelled at to change the season of the show you're watching with the only character in the game. 

Simply click to progress through the various screens.

2. Space

This game was based around the concept of personal space. Click and hold your mouse down to drag your character out of the ever-persistent path of the ragdoll. Fail to avoid him and suffer the consequences.

3. Endless Runner with Dynamic Difficulty Adjustment

This game is based around the revenge story of a toilet roll! Pursue your father's killer and avoid his "obstacles" as your pace increases and the difficulty rises!

Simply press "space" to jump!

4. Tangible and Interactive Media

I took this opporunity of interactivety to create a mobile game even I would love. Based around the ever-popular "Dungeons and Dragons" tabletop game, Dungeons and Chickens puts you in the place of three chickens on their quest to save their eggs from the tyrannous Farmer!

Tap the "fight" button and you'll be able to choose your attack, but remember all of your attacks come down to the roll of a dice so anything can happen!
